(50) 182Sth August, 1950Copy No.cabinet ministerial VISITS ABROADNote by the Prime minister it is useful that Ministers should visit from time to time territories and services overseas for which they are responsible and it is proper that the cost of such journeys(e.g., a visit by a Colonial Office Minister to a Colony or by an Admiralty Ministerto an R.N. establishment overseas) should be charged to public funds. ministers should not, however, charge to public funds the cost of visits made for the purposeof observing the working of a Government service abroad analogous to that forwhich they are responsible in the United Kingdom.Visits overseas, for whatever purpose, remain subject to the rules set out inSection VII of the notes on procedure annexed to CP. (49) 95 of 29th April, 1949,as revised by C.P.(50) 1 of 2nd January, 1950.C. R. A.10, Downing Street, SWA,Sth August, 1950.39163
